paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variant KCNH2-G628S, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In a porcine model of healed myocardial infarction and inducible VT, gene transfer of KCNH2‐G628S shut down the repolarizing IKr current, prolonging the myocyte refractory period and eliminating all ventricular arrhythmia inducibility.

In a porcine model of healed myocardial infarction and inducible VT, gene transfer of KCNH2‐G628S shut down the repolarizing IKr current, prolonging the myocyte refractory period and eliminating all ventricular arrhythmia inducibility.

In a porcine model of healed myocardial infarction and inducible VT, gene transfer of KCNH2‐G628S shut down the repolarizing IKr current, prolonging the myocyte refractory period and eliminating all ventricular arrhythmia inducibility.

In a porcine model of healed myocardial infarction and inducible VT, gene transfer of KCNH2‐G628S shut down the repolarizing IKr current, prolonging the myocyte refractory period and eliminating all ventricular arrhythmia inducibility.

functional_data.summary: KCNH2-G628S variant leads to prolonged myocyte refractory period and reduced arrhythmia susceptibility.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The variant was tested in a porcine model, showing significant effects on arrhythmia inducibility.
key_quotes: In a porcine model of healed myocardial infarction and inducible VT, gene transfer of KCNH2‐G628S shut down the repolarizing IKr current, prolonging the myocyte refractory period and eliminating all ventricular arrhythmia inducibility.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for the KCNH2 variant was extracted successfully.
